intro: Lepidium ruderale, commonly known as field cress, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small white or yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and often have a peppery aroma. The seeds are small, rounded, and contain compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal properties.
